name: Starfish at Sundance Sterling Silver and Resin Brooch
description:
Scene Stealers™ An adventure in your mind's eye with a story only you can tell.......

In the early morning hours of an unremarkable Tuesday morning in August, three hikers stumbled upon the charred body of a scuba diver in the middle of the forest. The new growth of scrub pines indicated a fire had decimated the area only a few short months before.

Next to the diver was a tiny starfish. So, how did the scuba diver get there? It turns out, to fight the blazing fires, the forest service scooped ocean water and carried it by plane to quell the fires. Only, this time, they scooped up the scuba diver as well.

A vintage map of Sundance is nestled in a cast sterling silver picture frame bezel that measures 1 5/8" by 1 3/16" The cast bronze star fish is partially submerged in jeweler's grade resin. The brooch is securely held with a clutch on the reverse.

The piece is signed and dated (2013) and will arrive in my signature box, shipped world wide any where you dream, swim or hike.

xoSherry

My Scene Stealers were a Cooper Hewitt Museum design pick: http://www.etsy.com/storque/shop/the-cooper-hewitt-national-design-museum-special-weekend-pic-2759/

name: Bicycle Race  Map Earrings Paris Brest
description:
Don't you love a bicycle race?

Paris-Brest-Paris (PBP) is the oldest cycling event still run. It began in 1891 as a 1200K race from Paris to Brest and then back to Paris again. 

Since 1931, it's actually been 2 races. The Brevet, which is an individual cycling race held every 4 years, and the audax. This race is held every five years, and cyclists ride in a group. 

To commmorate this race,I've designed these sterling earrings with vintage travel maps set in sterling bezels, 13mm by 18mm and covered with magnifying doming resin.

Your earrings will arrive in my signature box shipped worldwide, even if it's not Paris

The 3rd photo will show you how the earrings hang.
